title: Lake Meredith National Recreation Area: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit         A beautiful evening at Lake Meredith. Photo courtesy of Abigail M. White  For generations, Lake Meredith has been the Panhandle's favorite destination for summer fun. Whether you have a few hours or a few days, Lake Meredith offers something for everyone.   Â    If you have a few hours, you might:  Take a stroll along the Harbor Bay Trail Attend a Ranger-led activity (spring, summer and fall seasons) Help your kids earn their Junior Ranger badges by completing a Junior Ranger activity book  If you have a few days, you could plan into your visit:  Camping at one of our ten campgrounds, such as Sanford-Yake or Fritch Fortress campgrounds Hiking along the Canadian River on the South Turkey Creek Trail Hunting or fishing (check with Park Headquarters for regulations, seasons and limits) Attending a special event offered throughout the calendar year    Dig Deeper Into Planning Your Visit   Basic Information on Lake Meredith National Recreation Area Check Operating Hours and Seasons View a schedule of Special Events happening at Lake Meredith
